Incident.Summary: On December 11, 2023, members of the Firearms Enforcement Unit were assigned an NICS denial provided by the ATF investigation in reference to William Robert MATHEWS (W/M DOB: 5/8/1966). MATHEWS attempted to purchase a rifle and was denied due to a conviction of Arson Threat on March 8, 2017, Worcester County, Maryland Circuit Court (Case Number: C-23-CR-17-000158). Investigators made contact with MATHEWS and arrangements were made with MATHEWS'S girlfriend, Linda Lee Belovics (W/F DOB: 11/16/1972), to conduct a Knock-and-Talk at the residence of 401 144th Street, Ocean City, Worcester County, Maryland 21844.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: SCENE PROCESS: Investigators were equipped with a Body Worn Camera (BWC). All footage was recorded:partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1">https://mdsp.evidence.com/axon/evidence?evidence_id=178d2b240ccf42f2915b9ac8f4df3f93partner_id=5ed6a168304e40eb9a0cfb1a226ef1a1. NARRATIVE: On December 11, 2023, members of the FEU were assigned an NICS denial provided by the ATF investigation in reference to William Robert MATHEWS (W/M DOB: 5/8/1966). On November 30, 2023, MICHAEL attempted to purchase a firearm from an FFL in Stevensville, Queen Annes Maryland, and was subsequently denied. MATHEWS was deemed a prohibited person in Maryland for possessing any firearms for a guilty conviction for Arson Threat on March 8, 2017, Worcester County, Maryland Circuit Court (Case Number: C-23-CR-17-000158). MATHEWS was queried through the Department of Natural Resources (DNR) database with a 2010 hunting license and Maryland Automated Firearms Services System (MAFSS) database with a positive result Make: Thompson Center Model: Contender Caliber: 22 Serial Number: 304037. On December 13, 2023, Investigators contacted MATHEWS via telephone, identified themselves, and explained the nature of the call, which MATHEWS understood. MATHEWS advised that he resides with his girlfriend, Linda Lee Belovics (W/F DOB: 11/16/1972), at 401 144thStreet, Ocean City, Maryland 21844. MATHEWS advised investigators that he purchased the firearm in 1994. He explained in the spring of 1999 he gave the firearm to his father Bill Julian Mathews (W/M DOB: 6/30/1945). MATHEWS advised that his father is deceased (8/17/2018) and does not have any recollection of the whereabouts of the firearm. MATHEWS stated that he is currently in Montgomery County, Maryland for work purposes, however, he advised that his girlfriend is home at the residence. Investigators were able to make contact with Belovics and explain the reason for the call, and arrangements were made to conduct a knock-and-talk. Investigators responded to 401 144thStreet, Ocean City, Maryland 21844, and contacted Belovics at her residence. Investigators provided Belovics a Consent to Search Form (MSP 78), which she signed permitting investigators to search the residence. Investigators searched the residence with no items seized. Investigators provided Belovics with a copy of the Consent to Search Form (MSP 78). All the above events occurred in Worcester County, Maryland. I request this case to be unfounded.
